div.p: Maria-Josepha-Park, park in the 3rd district of Vienna (Landstraße), near the Südbahnhof (Southern Railway Station) and the Vienna Arsenal, a few minutes' walk south from Schenker's apartment at Keilgasse 8. After the end of World War I and following the generous charity drives of the Swiss for the population of Vienna, the park was renamed the Schweizer Garten (Swiss Garden).
Two days after the diagnosis of his diabetes on April 6, 1914, Schenker's first treatment took place in the Maria-Josepha-Park (OJ 1/14, p. 550).
